google_reviews.author: Aidannnjames
google_reviews.review: Signed lease renewal, now they're trying to force us into a new more expensive lease. Office essentially called me a liar when I tried to explain that all parties attempted to sign. Theres also rats living everywhere on the property.

ownerResponse.text: We apologize for any confusion during the renewal process. All parties on the lease need to complete the lease signing by the renewal deadline in order to receive that renewal offer pricing. Additionally, we are continuing strict pest management measures at the property and will monitor it closely. We hope we have been able to resolve your concerns to your satisfaction and look forward to improving your experience.

google_reviews.author: Tori Lehman
google_reviews.review: It took them months to fix a door that was broken when I moved in, and they continued contacting me for weeks after it was replaced to ask if I still needed it fixed. There are cracks in the ceiling and dents in the walls that were not marked on the move in inspection, so expect to document everything floor to ceiling if you want your deposit back. My toilet and kitchen outlets will randomly stop working and maintenance does nothing to fix either issue, just telling us to "call if it gets worse". The on-site washers/dryers are expensive for how poorly they clean, are out of service 90% of the time, and have ripped up my roommates clothes twice. You can find a unit in downtown Bham for half the cost and twice the charm.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for sharing your experience at Monterra. We are sorry to hear that you have encountered issues with maintenance and the appliances. We strive to provide prompt and efficient service, and we apologize for any inconvenience caused. We would like to discuss your concerns with you further and address any outstanding issues. Please reach out to us directly at the leasing office so we can schedule a meeting at your convenience. Thank you again for your feedback, and we hope to hear from you soon.

google_reviews.author: Veronica Cruz Smith
google_reviews.review: DONT MOVE HERE. Rats everywhere. Whole property smells like rat poop. Management neglects the property and is rarely present or reachable. Your rent will go up every year while living conditions go down the hole. Any tenant is accepted, so expect fights, parties, aggressive dogs off leash, and every weekend no parking.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at Monterra. We appreciate you having contacted us directly. We are actively working to address your concerns. We thank you for having brought them to our attention.

google_reviews.author: Wava Vautour
google_reviews.review: When Monterra took over they definitely could tell Cambridge Square needed a lot of tlc. While some have complained about the construction, it all needed to be done in order to fix and update the units and get rid of all the mold. It is refreshing to finally see our rent money go towards a better (and healthier) living experience. Andrew is a kind and thoughtful property manager to have around the community as well. He always makes sure the residents are happy here.

ownerResponse.text: Hello Wava, Thank you for providing this feedback. It's good to know that our residents are happy and excited about our community improvements. We also appreciate your kind words about Andrew, he is a valued team member. As always, let us know if we can be of assistance!

google_reviews.author: Alex Ruderman
google_reviews.review: This place is horrible. Its cheap for a reason. Apt #357 has had cracks in the ceiling for MONTHS and Before even attempting to fix. There have been multiple instances of sewage water coming up into the bathroom and into the yard. PTLA / APEX management is horrible. Avoid at all cost.

ownerResponse.text: Hey Alex. We apologize for the maintenance issues in your previous unit and thank you for your continued patience as we navigate through repairs. Please feel free to contact us directly at your earliest convenience if you have any further questions or concerns!

google_reviews.author: Colton Strong
google_reviews.review: This has been by far the worst property management company I have ever dealt with. They absolutely do not care about thier current tennants and only about bringing new unknowing clientele. I have lived here peacefully for nearly 2 years and it wasnt until Montera took over that life here has just been on issue after another with this place. We have had belongings stolen and where told it wasnt thier problem, they change the laundry from $2 to $3.50 per load yet the dryer is no bigger so basicly doubling the price, they will have jack hammers and leaf blowers going on before 9 am. So to anyone who works nights, your screwed on sleep. And not to mention to crazy lady that im sure plenty of people have complain,ed about. All in all Monntera apartments is only her to get you in and take your money so they can pay for all these maintenance changes and charge you even more for an apartment that is no better than before on the inside. This place has no regard for its current tennants and the life style they have been accustomed to in their own homes. Shame!

ownerResponse.text:
Dear Colton, Thank you for the review and feedback about our management at Monterra Apartments.  We are truly sorry that you are displeased with the processes so far at the community and encourage you to stop by the leasing office to discuss it further in person.

We are sorry to hear about the theft that occurred and encourage you to report to the police and to our office staff.

We are currently making some great changes at Monterra to do some needed updating to the community. This includes updating the laundry facilities. We see that the laundry pricing was set incorrectly and will adjust through our provider to better meet our residents' needs.

We are doing construction on resident stairwells & walkways, landscaping, interior renovations in some homes, and an exterior resident lounge area.  We do realize that construction work schedules may not coincide with some of our residents' schedules, and we do apologize for the inconvenience this causes.

We truly appreciate your patience during the remodeling process and encourage any feedback on how we can better communicate the work schedules to our residents.

google_reviews.author: Bry Yates
google_reviews.review:
The absolute worst management Ive dealt with living in Bellingham. I thought the shaddiness and scheming landmark was bad, this is the worst experience Ive had. I am getting woke up before 9 AM because of a jack hammer and because of a LEAF BLOWER. WHY? They also decide to shut the water off before the times they say they are going to shut them off, people need water to get ready to work and go to school! We had huge pot holes for a month or more! Theyve remodeled our laundry situation. They told us that these new machines would have all these cool features and that they wouldnt be coin operated. After not being able to do our laundry during the switch, the new machines do not have all that was promised and ARE MORE EXPENSIVE NOW THAN BEFORE. Almost double on the price to do a load of laundry!! And not every floor is hooked up so you will traverse multiple floors just to do laundry. Ive been very communicative with this management and I have not received a single email back from them. I could go on and on about this place but I would end up writing a book. This has been almost 6 months of chaos and distruption in our lives since the new management. I would not recommend.
Edit: THE LEAF BLOWER TOOK LESS THAN 30 MINUTES. Woke the whole complex up before 9 am, amazing planning.

ownerResponse.text:
Bree, we're so sorry for any inconvenience that you've experienced because of our property maintenance and construction. Unfortunately, these are operations that are necessary to maintain and improve our community. We recognize, however, that this can be extremely frustrating. Please don't hesitate to reach out to us to discuss this issue.

We recently repaired the potholes at the community, and we are in the process of remedying the issues with our new laundry machines through our service provider. Our priority is making Monterra a great place to live for all our residents, and we appreciate your feedback as we work to improve.

google_reviews.author: Space Gnome
google_reviews.review: Welcome to Monterra Apartments. Monterra has plummeted downhill over the past few years especially now since Andrew, the only redeeming factor of this place has left and I don't blame him. I would recommend moving here in a few years time once the leaks have been minimized to twice a day. That is of course If you can find anywhere to park and are not blinded by the horrendous blue color that monterra was recently painted. By moving here you WILL become much much uglier as you will be waking up at 8am every day due to leaf blowers, construction cranes and complimentary roofing nails which you will find in the parking lot. Luckily I am so adapted to the sound of construction that I know my different machinery and can now work for the local construction company. If you can manage to read this message over the incessant yelling, hammering and beeping or are deaf this is the ideal place for you. Welcome!

ownerResponse.text: We truly value your feedback, and we apologize for the disruptions caused by construction at the property. We do our best to be considerate of residents by containing construction to the hours of 8:00am-6:00pm, but we know that doesnt work with every residents schedule, and we are working diligently to get these projects completed as soon as possible. Our residents satisfaction is our goal, and we would love to have the opportunity to discuss your concerns with you directly. Please feel free to stop by the office during office hours or give us a call.

google_reviews.author: Mom Tom
google_reviews.review: Ptla management completely ruined this place. They have upcharged us on just about anything they could possibly think of and made every maintenance request feel like it was below them to fix. Don't expect your deposit back and take as many pictures as you can if you ever want to rent from them.

ownerResponse.text: We're sorry that you're not enjoying your living experience at Monterra. We strive to make our residents happy and want our community to be a place that everyone loves to call home. Please be assured that your concerns matter to us. Kindly reach out to us at your convenience to discuss what we can do to improve your time here.

google_reviews.author: m p
google_reviews.review: THIS IS A DANGEROUS PLACE TO LIVE. Was a decent place while Landmark still owned it, and I never imagined Id have a good thing to say about those clowns. Theres a woman living in the complex who, I can say without exaggeration, terrorizes the community all hours of the day at random. Many of the residents are students and expect to live in a place that is reasonably quiet at, say, 1-3AM, but not Monterra at Cambridge Square. Management has been made aware of the situation and have delivered eviction notice after the woman assaulted a resident. Pursue a lease at this address if you are interested in having an unstable neighbor: pound on your door and windows with a crowbar attempting to break into your apartment at any hour, leave burning candles in public spaces over spilt alcohol, scream at the absolute top of her lungs sporadically troughout the day, leave garbage and random objects at your door and strewn about the property, and potentially attack you on your way in or out of the building. The list of her insane antics is over a mile long. Management is dealing with the issue but legal action is slow and in the meantime we have to live with this daily terror. STUDENTS AND FAMIIES: DO NOT MOVE HERE OR LET YOUR CHILD LIVE HERE. IT IS A DANGEROUS PLACE AND POLICE INTERVENTION/LEGAL INTERVENTION HAS DONE NOTHING OVER THE LAST MONTH TO MAKE IT SAFE. She was arrested for attacking police officers at Starving sams down the street and for drug possession, but since her release has returned to Cambridge square and has begun to terrorize everyone again. I cannot wait to terminate my lease and urge ANY potential renter to avoid this place like the plague. It has been an absolute nightmare.

ownerResponse.text:
Thank you for reaching out to us as our residents concerns are very important to us.  We are committed to giving our residents a wonderful living experience at Monterra Apartments and take situations like this very seriously.  As you mentioned in your review, we are in the process of addressing the issue as required by Washington State Landlord Tenant Law and hope to have resolution quickly in this matter.

We would like to invite you to reach out to us to schedule a time to speak at the leasing office to address your concerns in person.

google_reviews.author: Tyler Steinberg
google_reviews.review: We had a seeing scheduled and no one was there or bothered to tell us when theyd be back

ownerResponse.text: Hey Tyler, we are sorry to see you are dissatisfied with our community! Please reach out to our main office so we can gain some insight into how to better serve you.

google_reviews.author: Zachary Toombs
google_reviews.review: Nice, just could use a little TLC on the outside...

google_reviews.author: Charlie Young
google_reviews.review: Shoddy workmanship on the buildings and difficult to park.

ownerResponse.text: Were sorry to see this low rating, Lee. We hope youll contact us directly to allow us an opportunity to address any concerns you may have. Thank you.
Thank you for your five-star rating of Monterra! We appreciate your residency, Jayden!
